class.name: Witch
proficiency: a) Intelligence + 1 Major + 1 Minor save or b) Wisdom + 1 Major or 2 Minor saves or c) Charisma + 1 Major + 1 Minor save.

tools: three from among the following: {@item Alchemist's Supplies|Ishiir}, {@item Cook's Utensils|Ishiir}, {@item Enchanter's Supplies|Ishiir}, {@item Herbalist's Kit|Ishiir}, {@item Poisoner's Kit|Ishiir}.

default: (a) a {@item component pouch|phb} or (b) an {@item druidic focus|phb} or (c) an {@item arcane focus|phb}
(a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to cast spells through your familiar and communion with the ancient forces that you are sworn to. The information below details how you use those rules with Witch spells, which appear on the {@filter Witch spell list|spells|class=witch (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know three cantrips of your choice from the Witch spell list. You learn additional witch cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Witch table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Witch Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose four level 1 spells from the {@filter Witch spell list|spells|class=witch (Ishiir)|source=Ishiir}.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Witch levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Witch Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Witch spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Witch, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

If another Witch feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Witch spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir}, you can replace one of your prepared spells with another Witch spell for which you have spell slots.
Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can change your list of prepared spells, replacing any of the spells there with other Witch spells for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice) is the spellcasting ability for your Witch spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an arcane or druidic focus as a spellcasting focus for your witch spells.

classFeature.name: Bonded Familiar
entries: Through the vagaries of fate, your own study of the supernatural, or other circumstances you have come into contact with a mystical force or great entity whom you are sworn to serve. As a proxy and teacher, you are provided with a constant companion in the form of a bonded familiar.

This familiar takes the form of a beast, celestial, elemental, fiend, plant, or undead of CR 0, which you choose. It uses the corresponding statblock of the creature, but uses your proficiency bonus and mental ability scores in place of its own. In addition to its own, it also shares your saving throw proficiencies and any of your skill proficiencies that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. For each level in this class, it also gains 4 additional hit points. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, your bonded familiar regains all its hit points.
Your bonded familiar can understand and speak all languages you speak. While it is on the same plane of existence as you, you can communicate with it telepathically.
Your bonded familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, you can shunt your bonded familiar into a safe pocket dimension. You can recall it to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you in the same manner.

Should your bonded familiar die, you can resummon it with a special ritual that takes 10 minutes. Alternatively, you can resummon it as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} by spending a spell slot of 1st level or higher.

classFeature.name: Witchcraft
entries: Through arcane study and the guidance of your bonded familiar, you learn special occult practices and abilities. You gain four witchcraft options of your choice. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} you can replace one witchcraft you know with another one.

entries.name: Amelioration
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you touch a creature that is {@condition Blinded|Ishiir}, {@condition Deafened|Ishiir}, {@condition Poisoned|Ishiir}, or is afflicted with a disease and magically alleviate its affliction. The target does not suffer the effects of your choice of one of these conditions until the start of your next turn. This does not remove the effects from the target and has no effect on them if they are reapplied during this time.

entries.name: Cackle
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you magically disrupt the ability to recover of one creature that can hear you within 60 feet. Until the start of your next turn, the target makes {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against ongoing effects on it with {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Evil Eye
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can curse a creature that you can see within 60 feet. The target has to make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} againt your spell save DC. On a failure, it subtracts {@dice 1d4} from the result of all {@variantrule D20 Test|Ishiir|D20 Tests} it makes until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Familiar Focus
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can perceive through your bonded familiar's senses in addition to your own. You can end this effect again as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}. Additionally, you can cast any spell or use any witchcraft option from your bonded familiar's space.

entries.name: Kettle Chant
entries: When you make a crafting check using {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir}, {@item cook's utensils|Ishiir}, {@item herbalist's kit|Ishiir}, or {@item poisoner's kit|Ishiir}, you add half your spellcasting ability modifier (rounded down).

entries.name: Mind Fog
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can befuddle the mind of a creature you can see within 60 feet and that is currently concentrating. The target immedidately has to make a Concentration {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. The DC is equal to 10 + half your Witch level (rounded up) + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries.name: Minor Prophecy
entries: Your gift for divination allows you to foresee minor events. When a creature you can see within 60 feet succeeds on or fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to turn the roll on the D20 into a 9 or 11 (your choice). You cannot use this feature again until you have finished a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Witch Spittle
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you touch a creature and rub spit laced with a minor healing enchantment over its injuries. The target regains hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. If the target is your bonded familiar, it regains additional hit points equal to your Witch level. A creature cannot benefit from this effect again until it has finished a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

classFeature.name: Bountiful Harvest
entries: Choose two tools from among {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir}, {@item cook's utensils|Ishiir}, {@item herbalist's kit|Ishiir}, or {@item poisoner's kit|Ishiir}. Your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|Proficiency Bonus} for checks with the chosen tools is doubled.
Additionally, when you forage for food or ingredients, you can roll the die on the result column twice and take the higher result.

classFeature.name: Witch Coven
entries: Choose a witch coven that you join from the list of available covens. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Improved Bonded Familiar
entries: Your bonded familiar can now also use the special actions gained through your Witchcraft. This does not change the number of uses a given feature has or how many times it can affect the same creature.
Additionally, your bonded familiar now also adds your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} to its AC.

classFeature.name: Witch Coven Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Witch Coven choice.

classFeature.name: Cauldron Rituals
entries: You learn a number of special rituals that you can complete as part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}. You may only choose one of these rituals at a time and the effects last until you complete your next {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Bounty of the Earth
entries: When you forage for food or ingredients, you can treat a d20 roll of 8 or lower as a 9. If your Foraging check is successful, you roll an additional d4 and add it to the result of the die on the result column.

entries.name: Eye of Newt, Wing of Bat
entries: Select a number of non-masterwork consumables equal to your spellcasting ability modifier that your group crafted on this Adventuring Day using {@item alchemist's supplies|Ishiir}, {@item cook's utensils|Ishiir}, {@item herbalist's kit|Ishiir}, or {@item poisoner's kit|Ishiir}. The selected items receive the masterwork property.

entries.name: Nature's Veil
entries: When your group makes a Prepare Campsite check, you can treat a d20 roll of 8 or lower as a 9. Additionally, you and up to 8 other creatures of your choice regain additional hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier + half your Witch Level when you complete your next {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir} on this Adventuring Day.

entries.name: Snake Stomach
entries: If your group consumes a meal as part of this rest, the duration of the effect is increased by 1 day. The same meal can only be affected by this ritual once.

entries.name: Whispers of the Wild
entries: When your group makes a Lookout check, you can treat a d20 roll of 8 or lower as a 9. Additionally, you add your spellcasting ability modifier to your passive Perception and that of up to 8 other creatures of your choice.

entries.name: Witch Path
entries: {@quickref Difficult terrain||3} doesn't slow your group's travel and whenever your group makes a Pathfinding check, you can treat a d20 roll of 8 or lower as a 9.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Improved Witchcraft
entries: Your knowledge of your craft deepens. You learn two additional Witchcraft options. Additionally, you can select two Witchcraft options you know, which improve as described below:

entries.name: Amelioration
entries: You can also use this feature on targets with the {@condition Confused|Ishiir}, {@condition Dazed|Ishiir}, {@condition Exhausted|Ishiir}, {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, {@condition Paralyzed|Ishiir}, and {@condition Stunned|Ishiir} conditions.

entries.name: Cackle
entries: You affect all creatures of your choice that can hear you within 60 feet.

entries.name: Evil Eye
entries: You can use this feature as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} or {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Familiar Focus
entries: As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can switch positions with your bonded familiar if you can see it.

entries.name: Kettle Chant
entries: The bonus to the listed crafting checks is now equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries.name: Mind Fog
entries: If the target fails the Concentration {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, it takes psychic damage equal to half your Witch level + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries.name: Minor Prophecy
entries: You gain 1 additional use of this feature. You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Witch Spittle
entries: The healing from this feature is doubled.

classFeature.name: Witch Coven Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Witch Coven choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Greater Bonded Familiar
entries: Your familiar learns all Witch cantrips you know and can cast them without material components. It uses your spellcasting attack bonus and spell save DC for these cantrips.

classFeature.name: Witch Coven Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Witch Coven choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Witch Coven Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Witch Coven choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Archfamiliar
entries: Your occult bond with your familiar is at the height of its power, granting you the following benefits:

entries.name: Bonded Magic
entries: Choose three Witch spells of 1st or 2nd level. You always have the chosen spells prepared. Your bonded familiar also learns these spells. Both of you can cast these spells without spell slots and without material components. It uses your spellcasting attack bonus and spell save DC for these spells.

entries.name: Life Ward
entries: When either you or your bonded familiar drop to 0 hit points but aren't killed out right, you can change the affected target's hit points to a number equal to triple your Witch level. You cannot use this feature again until you have completed a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Longevity
entries: The mystical powers coursing through you grant you an extended life span. For every nine years that pass, your body ages only one year.

subclassFeature.name: Coven of Alleyways Spells
entries: At each indicated Witch level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Coven of Alleyways Spells
rows: {@spell Disguise Self|Ishiir}, {@spell Expeditious Retreat|Ishiir}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|Ishiir}, {@spell Invisibility|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Urban Lore
entries: You and your bonded familiar become {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|Proficient} in three skills out of the following: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation|Ishiir}, {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Persuasion}, and {@skill Sleight of Hand}. Both of you double your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} for one of the chosen skills, this need not be the same skill. Both of you can use your spellcasting ability score in place of the usual ability score for any of the chosen skills.

subclassFeature.name: Hex in the City
entries: You always have the {@spell Friends|Ishiir} and {@spell Charm Person|Ishiir} spells prepared. When you cast either spell, the target does not know that it was {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} by you unless it directly observed you casting the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Alleyway Rituals
entries: You learn the following additional Cauldron Rituals:

entries.name: Beguiling Performance
entries: Choose one creature. When the target performs a Perform check, it can treat a d20 roll of 8 or lower as a 9. If the Perform check is successful, it treats the result of the roll as 1 step better.

entries.name: Drunkard's Luck
entries: Choose one creature. When the target makes a Carouse check, it adds your spellcasting ability modifier to the result of the d20 roll.

entries.name: Eagle Eyes
entries: Choose one creature. When the target performs a Guard check, it can treat a d20 roll of 8 or lower as a 9. If the Guard check results in an encounter, the target cannot be surprised and adds your spellcasting ability modifier to its initiative roll.

entries.name: Gutter Remedies
entries: When you perform an Attend check, you can treat a d20 roll of 8 or lower as a 9. If your Attend check is successful, you roll an additional d4 and add it to the result of the die on the result column.

entries.name: Magpie's Blessing
entries: Choose one creature. When the target makes a Pickpocket check, it rolls 2d8 and adds them to the result of the die on the result column if the check was successful. If the check was a failure, it adds your spellcasting ability modifier to any checks made to evade the authorities.

entries.name: Twisted Fortune
entries: Choose one creature. The target rolls 2d8 and adds them to the result of the die on the result column, regardless of whether the Gambling check was successful or not.

subclassFeature.name: Mirror, Mirror
entries: When you cast a spell of up to 5th level that can only target yourself, you can choose your bonded familiar as a second target if it is within 60 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Rat Father's Blessing
entries: You can now target other creatures beside your bonded familiar for the purposes of your Mirror, Mirror feature.

You and any other creature that are currently {@condition Invisible|Ishiir} through a spell or feature of yours have their speed doubled and can {@action Hide|Ishiir} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}.

entries.subclassFeature: Coven of Dark Sisters Spells|Witch|Ishiir|Dark Sisters|Ishiir|3

subclassFeature.name: Coven of Dark Sisters Spells
entries: At each indicated Witch level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Coven of Dark Sisters Spells
rows: {@spell Bane|Ishiir}, {@spell Dissonant Whispers|Ishiir}, {@spell Arcane Rend|Ishiir}, {@spell Blindness/Deafness|Ishiir}

subclassFeature.name: Grim Satisfaction
entries: Whenever a creature fails a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against one of your Witch spells or features, you and your bonded familiar gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier + half your Witch level (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Curse Specialist
entries: You always have the {@spell Bestow Curse|Ishiir} spell prepared and it does not count against your Concentration limit, though the initial instance of the spell ends if you cast it again. If you fail a Concentration {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} and you are currently concentrating on more than one spell, you lose concentration on both spells.

subclassFeature.name: Contagious Curse
entries: If the target of {@spell Bestow Curse|Ishiir} drops to 0 hit points before the end of their duration, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to move the curse to a new creature you can see within range.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Sister's Scorn
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet hits you or your bonded familiar with an attack or forces you to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to curse that creature. The target has to make a Charisma {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}. On a failure, it is subject to one of the effects of the {@spell Bestow Curse|Ishiir} spell until the start of its next turn.
If the target is already under the effect of {@spell Bestow Curse|Ishiir}, it stacks with this feature as long as you choose a different curse effect.

subclassFeature.name: Tenebrous Trinity
entries: When you cast {@spell Bestow Curse|Ishiir}, its range increases to 120 feet and you can choose up to three targets instead of one.
